repnme.cdata!:
Organization of Eastern Caribbean States
            (OECS) - Telecommunications and Information Communications
            Technology (ICT) Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Telecommunications and
            Information Communications Technology (ICT) Development
            Project for Organization of Eastern Caribbean States (OECS)
            were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was low or negligible, the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower performance
            was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            coordination of a regional project is complex and stretches
            very thinly in terms of both project management and
            supervision resources. Five set of Ministers of
            Communications, and Prime Ministers, NTRCs and ECTEL
            (National Telecommunication Regulatory Commission and
            Eastern Caribbean Telecommunications Authority) were
            involved at critical junctures in project implementation.
            Even with the best intentions, the coordination to obtain
            signatures from all member countries on any change such as
            category reallocation or extension of the closing dates was
            a hard task. As a suggestion for future regional projects,
            resources to be deployed to project coordination will
            require to be full-fledged defined. A consideration for
            other ICT project in small countries it that it could be
            beneficial to share the fixed costs of ICT development and
            policy and regulation projects. Normal practice worldwide is
            for telecommunications policy and regulatory issues to be
            addressed on a national basis. A regional approach was seen
            as viable since the telecommunications issues facing each
            island were similar. A useful tool that could help future
            projects in countries with little experience in World Bank
            competitive bidding processes is the organization of
            business outreach workshops that provide with the knowledge
            to service providers. These workshops were found
            particularly helpful when dealing with ICT procurement processes.

repnme.cdata!:
Organization of Eastern Caribbean States
            (OECS) - Telecommunications and Information Communications
            Technology (ICT) Development Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Telecommunications
            and Information Communications Technology (ICT) Development
            Project is to improve access, quality and use of ICT
            services to achieve socio-economic development in the
            Organization of Eastern Caribbean States (OECS). The project
            is structured along four components: (1) support for legal
            and regulatory reforms, aimed at promoting additional
            competition in the sector and reduce tariffs; (2) universal
            Access or service, aimed at promoting extension of access to
            ICT services to underserved areas through the creation of
            Universal Service Funds (USF) and implementation of
            sub-projects; (3) ICT pilot projects, aimed at improving
            growth and competitiveness in ICT-enabled services through
            the use of broadband and innovative ICT applications; and
            (4) support for the management of the project by Eastern
            Caribbean Telecommunications Authority (ECTEL), the regional
            implementing agency.

display_title.display_title:
Organization of Eastern Caribbean
            States (OECS) - Telecommunications and Information
            Communications Technology (ICT) Development Project :
            restructuring : Main report

repnme.cdata!:
Organization of Eastern Caribbean States
            (OECS) - Telecommunications and ICT Development Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Telecommunications
            and Information Communication Technology (ICT) Development
            Project for Organization of Eastern Caribbean States (OECS)
            is to improve the access, quality and use of
            telecommunications and ICT services to achieve
            socio-economic development in the OECS. The reallocation is
            necessary to correct a mistake that was made by the World
            Bank in processing an earlier reallocation request. The
            reallocation is also necessary in order to meet urgent
            payments that have become due under category one, as well as
            to adjust the funding under category three, for credits,
            which had been mistakenly over-drafted.
